text: CONFIDNETIAL//GRAY//NOT FOR PUBLIC

Problem Statement: Warfighters need potable water within 72 hours for survival, but water transport is costly, inefficient, and vulnerable in contested environments. ROWPU systems are predictable, maintenance-heavy, and require frequent filter changes. WaterCube ® overcomes these challenges, supporting sustained operations in forward areas under ACE, MEU, and MDO concepts where mobility and operational freedom are critical.

Project Description:  Genesis Systems' WaterCube ® (Renewable Water from Air) technology, developed through partnerships with AFRL and Army Research Labs under five SBIR contracts over 6 years, is designed for military use.

Benefit to Warfighter: Provides clean, reliable water at the point of need, eliminating water resupply, reducing unit footprint, and removing chlorine treatment. WaterCube ® enhances mobility and operational flexibility, ending reliance on external sustainment.
Schedule:
Additional Facility Standup – Production ramp-up	Q2 FY26
Initial delivery of 39 WaterCube ® systems	Q4 FY26
Achieve full rate production Capability	Q1 FY27
Mid Point Production – 292 WaterCube ® systems delivered	Q4 FY28
Remaining of 581  WaterCube ® systems delivered	Q4 FY29
Key Participants:
Project Owner: USAFRICOM
Industry Partner: Genesis Systems
Sustainment Partner: INDOPACOM

Other Stakeholders: USAFRICOM, USINDOPACOM, PACAF, HQ USAF, US Army DEVCOM, AFIMSC, 11th Air Task Force (ATF), 12th ATF, 13th ATF, 21st ATF, 22nd ATF, 23rd ATF, 270th CAOS, USMC 3rd Littoral Battalion, 8th Theater Sustainment Command
41 WC-1000M WaterCube® one thousand gallon per day systems
118 WC-100M WaterCube® one hundred gallon per day systems
422 WC-10M WaterCube® ten gallon per day water generator systems
All military WaterCube® systems are EMP/Cyber hardened
Parts benchstock for maintenance and repair sustainment
Key Deliverables:

$50M APFIT funding will provide ramp up capability and initial procurement of 39 systems by Q4 FY26 with full delivery of 581 systems by Q4 FY29. INDOPACOM will continue procurement and sustainment using POM’d funding (table).
Water from Air at the Point of Need
Unlimited Potable Water from the Air
